description: From Latin troglodyticus, Ancient Greek τρωγλοδυτικός (trōglodutikós, “of cave-/hole-dwellers”) from τρωγλοδύτης (trōglodútēs, “cave-/hole-dweller”) from τρώγλη (trṓglē, “hole”) + δύω (dúō, “enter, go into”).

adjectives.description: troglodytic (comparative more troglodytic, superlative most troglodytic)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to troglodytes, or dwellers in caves.
